SENT.plain: We report a 33-year-old woman who had a 60-mm thoracic aneurysm of the ascending aorta with Marfan syndrome and effort angina due to compression of the right coronary artery (RCA) by the aneurysm
Surgery was performed using the Bentall procedure and a coronary artery bypass graft to the RCA
Postoperatively, coronary angiography showed that the coronary flow of the RCA was restored by removing the aneurysmal compression
The patient was discharged without angina on postoperative day 21
